result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Dean Louis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joshua D. Louis in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Joshua D. Louis in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   3:23 PM  Court calls case(s).  Court advised the defendant as to his right to have a preliminary exam.  DE does not wish to have a preliminary hearing.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim - finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  





  Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua D. Louis in court, in custody appearing by video. with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court, Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kemp motions court for reduction in cash bond.  DA objects.  Court denies motion for bond reduction.  
Due to DE's attorney's schedule inability to work with court calendar, no choice but to go beyond 10 day time limit requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:10 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
PD appointment

Defendant Joshua D. Louis in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Moldenhauer states he has a potential conflict in at least one of the DE's cases which have been all been set for Preliminary Hearings today.  (15CF34, 16,109,111,112)
DE does not object to withdrawal, is advised of rights to preliminary hearing which is offered to still be held today.   DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing in all cases.
 Court allows withdrawal of Atty Moldenhauer.
Atty Moldenhauer motions court to allow DEF furlough to attend a funeral in MN.  State objects due to effort that would be needed to get DEF back to this state if he does not return.  Court denies.
Bond continues.  Conditions of bond are presented on the record to the DEF while he is present, as they were changed on 2-26-16 after DEF was no longer connected to the courtroom by video.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
